intro: Camellia ngheanensis, commonly known as the Nhean camellia, is a rare species native to Vietnam. It is a flowering plant in the Theaceae family, characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with a waxy texture, and bloom in late winter to early spring. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
